paper_abstract: We construct an n-dimensional polytope whose boundary complex is compressed and whose face numbers for any pulling triangulation are the coefficients of the powers of (x - 1)/2 in the nth Legendre polynomial. We show that the non-central Delannoy numbers count all faces in the lexicographic pulling triangulation that contain a point in a given open generalized orthant. We thus provide a geometric interpretation of a relation between the central Delannoy numbers and Legendre polynomials, observed over 50 years ago (Good in Proc. Camb. Philos. Soc. 54:39-42, 1958; Lawden in Math. Gaz. 36: 193-196, 1952; Moser and Zayachkowski in Scr. Math. 26: 223-229, 1963). The polytopes we construct are closely related to the root polytopes introduced by Gelfand et al. (Arnold-Gelfand mathematical seminars: geometry and singularity theory, pp. 205-221. Birkhauser, Boston, 1996).
